alert.note: Alert for Accomack (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Somerset, Worcester and northern Accomack Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 615 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Snow Hill to near Marion Station to 7 miles west of Tylerton. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Snow Hill and Marion Station around 620 PM EDT. Newark and West Pocomoke around 625 PM EDT. Pocomoke City around 630 PM EDT. Lawsonia around 645 PM EDT. Parksley around 700 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Horntown, Hallwood, Mappsville, Cokesbury, Goodwill, Greenbackville, Kingston, Saxis, Wallops Island and Temperanceville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
